triplets: Italian staple food made from dough, dried or fresh, in various shapes
Boiling and serving with sauce, baking in casseroles, soups, and salads
Durum wheat flour, water, eggs, and sometimes vegetable pigments
Dough formed into shapes like spaghetti, penne, fusilli, etc.
Typically yellow; can be green (spinach), red (tomato), or black (squid ink)
Pasta manufacturers, artisanal producers, and home cooks
Dried: 1–2 years; fresh: a few days refrigerated
